question: What is GDG Cebu Code Camp and what can I expect from this event?
answer:
The Code Camp will focus on essential technical topics for developers, along with updates on the current development trends. The topics will range from Machine Learning, Firebase, and the Cloud, to Material Design, Android, and 2017's Web Trends.

For this special event, attendees will be learning about these topics from Googlers (Google employees) themselves, who will be flying in from South Korea, Japan, Singapore and the US.

question: When will it be and where is the venue?
answer: It will be held this February 25 at IEC Convention Center, Pope John Paul II Ave, Cebu City.

question: Is the event for free? Where can I register?
answer: Yes, it is free! You can sign up and register at https://cebucodecamp.eventbrite.com.

question: Is the registration still ongoing?
answer: You can still register at the link that we provided above, but the registration is on a first come, first served basis. You need to register as soon as possible or there will be no slots available for you.

question: When is the cut-off of your registration?
answer: The cut-off for registration will be ending before the prior date of the event. There will no re-opening of slots. The registration is basically made on first come, first serve basis.

question: Can you please elaborate the three categories stated in the registration page?
answer:
We subdivided the participants into three groups:
Beginner Developers - Student Developers - Entry-level Developers
Experienced Developers - Working Developers Professionals
Senior Developers - developers with 3+ years experience in the industry

The experience is not necessarily related to Google-related technology. What matters most is that you are a working developer or professional.

It is important for attendees to be in the right category to ensure that the activities that they will be participating in will be relevant and appropriate to the level of experience.

question: Will I be able to receive a confirmation that the registration is successful?
answer: An email confirmation and a ticket for the event will be sent to you after you register. We will also be asking you to confirm your attendance a week before the event.

question: I thought that registration is on a first come, first serve basis. How come you posted that you will be denying the entry of those 'Beginner Developers' who signed up using 'Experienced Developers' tickets?
answer: The registration is indeed on a first come first serve basis within the categories. If you signed up first under your category, you will get the slot first. You don’t need to worry. This post is intended for those people who did not registered to their correct category. You don’t need to worry.

question: I saw that the slots for the students category is already full. Can I just register to the other categories?
answer: You cannot register to the other categories. You don’t need to worry because we might be increasing the slots soon. We just need to assess first. Just keep posted.

question: Do you need some proof that someone is an experienced or senior developer?
answer: No, we don’t need any proof. It is because we trust that attendees will follow instructions and respect the categories. After all, we must all do our part to have a successful event.

question: I wasn’t able to register at eventbrite. Can I just pay you guys and let me in?
answer: We will be strictly implementing a no ticket, no entry policy during the event. If you weren’t able to register, you may just check our Facebook page for updates.

question: Will you provide transport service?
answer: We will not be providing transport service.

question: On the event day, what time will the registration start?
answer: The registration will start at exactly 7:30 AM.

question: Can I just join in the afternoon session?
answer: We will be closing our registration at 10 AM. We will not be entertaining latecomers after that.

question: My friend wants to go with me but he wasn’t able to register. Can I bring a plus one?
answer: We strictly implement a no ticket, no entry policy. Your friend can just visit our facebook page for updates.

question: What should we bring on the event day?
answer:
Please do not forget to bring your ticket and a valid ID for verification. If you want to take notes, you may also bring a notebook or a pad paper. Laptops are also allowed.

For security purposes, please avoid bringing liquor, drugs, drug paraphernalia, bladed objects, daggers, knives, all sorts of deadly weapons, and other instruments deemed to be potentially lethal are strictly prohibited. Anyone caught in the possession of such objects will not be allowed to enter the venue and will be submitted to proper authorities.

question: What time will the event end?
answer: The event will end by 4 PM.

question: Will you provide free food?
answer: The organizers will be providing free food to the attendees.

question: Will there be shirts?
answer: Just come and you will know.

question: What are the event's official hashtag?
answer: #GDGCebu, #CebuCodeCamp, and #GDGC3

question: Will you provide certificates to the attendees?
answer: We will not be providing hard copies of certificates. Instead, an e-certificate will be sent to your emails after the event.

question: I want to know more about the event, GDG Cebu, and its activities. Where should I go?
answer:
You may check our social media channels:
Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/gdgcebuorg
Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/gdgcebu/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/gdgcebu
Google plus: https://plus.google.com/+GdgcebuOrg
Website: https://gdgcebu.org/
